intro: Oldenlandia capillipes, commonly known as the thread-leaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. The leaves are narrow and thread-like, giving the plant its common name, and it is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
